General_information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.

References.key: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4

key.name: Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Ra-223(2021)
key.Reference_of_the_published_comparison_re: Michotte C., Courte S., Nonis M., Coulon R., Judge S., Ratel G., Fr\'echou C., Cassette P., Keightley J., Kossert K., N\"{a}hle O., Final report of the new BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Ra-223 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{223}$Ra including the 2014 result of the NPL (United Kingdom), the 2014 result of the PTB (Germany) and the 2018 result of the LNE-LNHB (France), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/58/1A/06007}, {\textit{Metrologia}, 2021, \textbf{58}, Tech. Suppl., 06007}

key.name: Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Ra-223(2022)
key.Reference_of_the_published_comparison_re: Coulon R., Michotte C., Courte S., Nonis M., Ziemek T., Marganiec-Ga\l{}\c{a}zka J., Lech E., Saganowski P., Tymi\'{n}ski Z., Listkowska A., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Ra-223 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{223}$Ra including the 2021 result of the POLATOM (Poland), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/60/1A/06002}, {\textit{Metrologia}, 2023, \textbf{60}, Tech. Suppl., 06002}

Tomasz Ziemek, Justyna Marganiec-Ga\l{}\c{a}zka, Edyta Lech, Pawel Saganowski, Zbygniew Tymi\'{n}ski, Anna Listkowska

Data_from_POLATOM-2021.Reference_for_the_decay_data_used_by_the: B\' {e} M.-M., Chist\'{e} V., Dulieu C., Mougeot X., Chechev V.P., Kuzmenko N.K., Kondev F.G., Luca A., Gal\'{a}n M., Nichols A.L., Arinc A., Pearce A., Huang X., Wang B., \href{http://www.bipm.org/utils/common/pdf/monographieRI/Monographie_BIPM-5_Tables_Vol6.pdf}{\textit{Table of radionuclides}, Monographie BIPM-5, 2011, Vol 6}.
Data_from_POLATOM-2021.Chemical_composition_of_the_solution: RaCl2 in HCl, NaCl and sodium citrate
Data_from_POLATOM-2021.Comments_on_impurities_contained_into_th: Radioactive solution was measured on gamma spectrometer using HPGe detector. No impurities were detected in the solution. Xofigo\textregistered (radium Ra-223 dichloride) injection was used. Chemical composition was taken from drug prescribing information.

Data_from_PTB-2014.key: C.Michotte, S.Courte, M. Nonis, R. Coulon, S. Judge, G. Ratel

The final result is the weighted mean of the results of the two methods. The relative combined uncertainty (0.23~\%) of the TDCR result is adopted for the final result. This is larger than the internal and external relative uncertainties of the weigthed mean
Data_from_PTB-2014.Particularities_of_the_submission_to_the: 1 sample and average of several measurement methods

key.name: Activity measured by the laboratory / kBq
Date of the measurement by the BIPM international reference system (SIR)
Half-life used by the laboratory / d

Data_from_PTB-2014.Chemical_composition_of_the_solution: 223RaCl2, NaCl, sodium citrate dihydrate, calcium chloride dihydrate in HCl
Data_from_PTB-2014.Comments_on_impurities_contained_into_th: Chemical composition for the ampoule submitted to the SIR was taken from manufacturer's information. For absolute activity determination a dilution step was required using a carrier solution with a carrier concentration of 0.5\% BaCl$_2$$\cdot$2H$_2$O in 1~mol$/$L HCl(aq.). The dilution step was confirmed by liquid scintillation measurements when the activity was lower after about 2-3 weeks.

key.name: Equivalent activity measured by the SIR / kBq
Relative standard uncertainty (SIR contribution) of the equivalent activity / 1e-4

Data_from_PTB-2014.Comments_on_the_SIR_measurement: uncertainty dominated by the contribution from the decay correction

key.name: Combined standard uncertainty of the equivalent activity / kBq
Initials of the person(s) who verified the data plus the date
